teggr:
I've run the node-inspector on the code and the code appears to be caused by the multi_config_path module being called before the logger has been setup and it then throws an exception.
In the file: https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/index.js
Line 57: https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/index.js#L57
var multiConfigPath = require('./multi_config_path')(this);
  this.config_path = args.config ? multiConfigPath(base, args.config)
                                 : pathFn.join(base, '_config.yml');
...
  this.log = logger(this.env);
Because the logger is not initialised before the multi_config_path module, then the logger is not in the ctx var.
In the file: https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/multi_config_path.js
Line 66: https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/multi_config_path.js#L66
```
var log = ctx.log;
...
log.i('Config based on', count, 'files');
```
. Potentially you could initialise the multi_config__path after the logger unless there is another reason not to?. Maybe related to  #2499 . That change looks to be fine. I will test later. Thanks :). PR #2520 works great locally 👍 .

I ran into same issue, after updating  node 7.x.x. 
Rebuilding npm rebuild didn't work either, so 
After, some digging I was able to resolved it by following: 

cd `which hexo'/../..
rm -rvf node_modules
npm install

cd into your hexo-project
1. rm -rvf node_modules
2. npm install
Edit: *WARNING: It will remove all your modules, that's why you have to npm install. If you have limited BW or slow connection, don't blame me. :). @MikeMMao LOL, I know it completely empties your modules.

How it can do filesystem and why?. > If no language is set in _config, or the theme has no language file for the one set, then the translation data is chosen in indeterminate manner as it is taken from a list of all available translations returned by hexo.theme.i18n#list().
Not indeterminate manner, but take first catched language in themes/languages directory. So, if first language will de.yml, it's will set DE language if this 2 cases above will reproduce.
For now this pull create 1 additional bug in NexT theme: if 2 cases above will reproduce and default.yml not exists in themes/languages directory, no one language will be selected. So, for now it's mean need to create 1 additional symlink or rename en.yml on default.yml, but before this pull this bug was solved just by renaming en.yml on _en.yml.
Breaking Changes for most Hexo themes
This pull with 2 cases above will brake many themes in which default.yml in themes/languages not exists. There is the list:

~~NexT~~ (already fixed after check this changes) (~~old NexT~~ exists duplicate default.yml file of en.yml)
Tranquilpeak
~~Yilia~~ (en.yml renamed on default.yml by default)
Indigo
Material
Icarus
Apollo
Hueman
And many other themes which authors don't know this bug cases, looks like this:


So, this bugfix now produce ≈ 80% breaking changes for all Hexo themes.
@JLHwung, @NoahDragon, please, test pulls like that before merge for all possible breaking changes, Thank's!
Possible fixes for this changes

This ensures that if no language is set or the language cannot be found then default translation will be used.

Use first language in list (instead of this) if default.yml file not exists.. > Node's readdir on Windows does not provide a sorted list and even on Linux the underlying readdir C function makes no promises on ordering.
It's alphabetical or vice-versa. Will be load first or last language. But it's can't load random language, i think. So, it can't be called indeterminate manner.

Anyway, default platform is Linux and as i say here, this fix for now worse then was before.. I understand this, but we have for now badly situation then it was before:

Before fix: new Hexo / Theme user just install Hexo & Theme and with default config settings see first language in list (at most cases it's en.yml). Anyway, he will see any language without any bugs, before he will define needed by him language in main Hexo config.
After fix: with same situation, user don't see any language and just see untranslated values like post.posted, footer.theme, etc. and will think what this bug of Theme or, at least, of Hexo.

This is big difference from point of view new Hexo users and create some troubles for Theme mainteiners under Hexo (from this pull need at least to create additional symlink or duplicate file to around this bugfix).
Anyway, i report attention about this and suggest decision in comment to resolve this situation without revert current changes.. I think u see my opinion and i appreciate this. All maintainers of themes under the Hexo will appreciate this too, i think. And, yes, i already import fix on this fix, but as for me, always need to have any competidors in similar things, to be better for all of us.. Thank's. Looks better. :+1: . @segayuu > If there is no response after one week
Why week? Go about 1-2 month? It's normal period for awaiting something important.

rangerzhou:
通过npm install hexo-fs --save解决不了的，是因为在hexo-deployer-git中还有一个node_modules/hexo-fs目录，但是hexo-deployer-git官方Github中是没有这个目录的，可能是因为npm源没有更新，所以hexo-deployer-git中有一个旧版本的hexo-fs，注释掉E:\github\blog\node_modules\hexo-deployer-git\node_modules\hexo-fs\lib\fs.js中第718行exports.SyncWriteStream = fs.SyncWriteStream;就行了，或者手动更新hexo-deployer-git。
详情请见：http://rangerzhou.top/2017/07/27/Hexo%E5%8D%9A%E5%AE%A2%E6%B3%A8%E6%84%8F%E4%BA%8B%E9%A1%B9/.

感谢您参与开发的hexo ^_^~太好用了。 如我在新文档中使用如下代码(使用了hexo-asset-image `plugin，所以没有使用官方的asset_img语句。 紧贴测试图片上方一行的文字 ![](01.jpg ) 紧贴测试图片下方一行的文字 在生成的网页中，有的图片下方会增加一行空行，有的则不会。 会增加空行的网页：http://sd44.github.io/2017/07/07/%E7%A4%BE%E4%BC%9A%E5%AD%A6%E5%93%B2%E5%AD%A6%E7%90%86%E8%AE%BA%E5%B0%8F%E8%AF%8D%E5%85%B8%E2%80%94%E2%80%94%E6%8C%81%E7%BB%AD%E6%9B%B4%E6%96%B0/#more 不会增加空行的网页： http://sd44.github.io/2017/07/07/%E6%91%84%E5%BD%B1%E5%A4%A7%E5%B8%88%E5%8D%B0%E8%B1%A1%EF%BC%88%E5%85%AB%EF%BC%89%E2%80%94%E2%80%94-Stephen-Shore/#more （测试完后，可将以上链接删除。） 整体表现出无序。不知道图片下方与文字间什么时候会多加一行，也不知道什么时候他并不加这一行。 希望Hexo对于多图片的支持更好一些 ^_^~. 例子一：图片上下均有空行的效果

测试图片1上方

测试图片下方

例子二：图片上下均无空行的效果

测试图片2上方

测试图片2下方

例子三：图片上方有空格，下方无空行的效果

测试图片3上方


测试图片3下方

例子四：图片上方无空格，下方有空行的效果

测试图片4上方

测试图片4下方

结论： 如果文字与图片之间无空行，则文字和图片被

包括起来，
换行。 如果文字与图片之间有空行，则文字和图片分别被

包括起来， 因
与

的不同，造成不同的效果。 我不了解html或css，表述不清，抱歉。。。 图片和文字之间有无空行对阅读的舒适性还是较有影响的，特别是markdown这种只有一个空行的格式，感觉hexo应该加大这方面的可操控性。 . 谢谢积极关注这个问题 ^_^ 根据源代码，我不负责任地猜想下这情况是怎样发生的，希望有用，您可能也早想到了： 感觉hexo像分块来解析全文，生成标记。紧挨着的多个相连非空行，被认为是一个block，用p标签包括起来，用br标签处理上下紧邻两行。 如果不是紧挨着，就各自成p标签。 都是文字的情况下，符合逻辑。 但是插入图片行和文字行混合的情况下，就会导致p和br标签的混乱。 希望有用。。。。我描述能力太差。。也不懂技术。 .

wangfys:
I tried several times and I think I use the swig syntax correctly in the .swig file. I only think it's a strange problem caused because of the .md file. This is the original reward.swig file in the NexT theme. {% if theme.alipay or theme.wechatpay %}
{{ theme.reward_comment }}
{% if theme.wechatpay %}

微信打赏

{% endif %} {% if theme.alipay %}

支付宝打赏

{% endif %}
{% endif %} In fact I only changed the first line like this and all the other lines are the same. {% if page.reward and (theme.alipay or theme.wechatpay) %} Everything works fine before I post the article about how to change the swig file with such a line in the .md file `{% if page.reward and (theme.alipay or theme.wechatpay) %}`. I've tried this once and it works fine. (And it also works fine with brackets. I guess swig support brackets, at least using the renderer provided by Hexo) And I means almost everything works fine with both swig file (the original one and the one I modified). The only thing that works incorrectly is when I tried to put a piece of code from a swig file into a code block. I think the renderer should treat this piece of code as common code block (because I use the markdown style to define a code block), but it seems that the renderer treat this piece as a template (and it's only a broken piece, so it failed). I guess the renderer render swig templates before rendering markdown to HTML, so the renderer doesn't know it's a code block.. I think it's similar to such a case: Some text editor provide an unsafe 'Find and Replace' function. If I want to replace "A" to "AA", these type of editor will keep adding "A" behind the original "A". I don't know which swig renderer Hexo is using. But I think it's something like this: The renderer first adds all the articles (in markdown style) to index page. Then it follows the rule of the swig template to add different css style. After that, it change the markdown style into HTML style. So the code block in the markdown is treated as swig template first, not just some text. Then it throw an error and doesn't have the chance to render the markdown into HTML. Thanks a lot for the sample. I didn't notice that you edit the sample at once. And my friends also help me find another solution from a question on stackoverflow (how do i insert this code into hexo markdown) that use three backticks to define a code block can prevent such errors. It's also a very strange thing that use three backticks can work but using indents or just one backtick failed. So can this two solutions be added to some where in the documentation? I didn't find solutions in the documentation, especially in troubleshooting page, so I came here to ask. (Such problems are hard to use some key words to search I think. I use 'swig' and 'hexo' as key words and find nothing. But in fact there is similar problems on stackoverflow and also in the issues.) By the way... I don't quite understand your meaning. Share which part of the Hexo source code? I haven't read the Hexo source code yet (I just guess why this pheonmenon happens) and in fact it's my first time to use Hexo just a few days ago..

CITguy:
The fun thing about my setup is that I'm using Hexo to build out documentation for a design system. I've got Pages documenting each component and I'm using the Posts for release notes. Each component directory (source/components/myComponent/) contains all of the source files and documentation needed to consume that component (this is where my _partial.less files exist). 
My script doesn't use the Hexo server, but uses Browsersync to serve up the public/ directory. This is because the Hexo server doesn't watch for changes to all files (_partial.less) to automatically generate assets. So I have Browsersync watch for changes and call a forced generate from Hexo.
Hexo correctly generates content on deploy, but this Cache issue is frustrating while I'm trying to develop locally.

My scripts: https://gist.github.com/CITguy/94d1d33a5e36901e402a2cf8fbd27fd3.

I used the same variable name to provide a default value on the layout.ejs, and when needed overwrite it in child.ejs layout. 
Take the no_footer for example, I have a code block <% if(!no_footer) { %>this is the footer<% } %> inside layout.ejs, so all pages will have footer by default. but for child.ejs layout, I want to overwrite the default to true to make all page using the child.ejs has no footer.
Hope this explains what I meant to do.. This is still an issue for me.
It seems to me that the front matter of child layout is executed before the front matter of the child's parent layout. So the problem is that the variable on the parent would overwrite variable on the child. (Normally, child overwrite parent is more useful in programming in general)
So, without thinking too deeply into this matter, I am thinking reversing the order of the front matter execution would solve the problem. 
I don't know if I got some basics wrong, otherwise, I think this would be a good thing to change..

抱歉，我对Hexo和前端确实不熟悉，可能这些问题在您看来很基础，但能否提供另一些相关资料呢？. @NoahDragon 问题解决了一半……
我在项目路径下创建了一个目录 scripts，在其中新建了一个site_url.js，以下是内容:
```JavaScript
/ global hexo /
'use strict';
hexo.extend.tag.register("site_url", function (args, content) {
    return "http://example.com";
})
然后在post文章正文中这么使用:Markdown
 这里尝试直接输出 
{% site_url %}
额外添加选项(Options)
2: {% site_url %}/somelink
```
最终结果：
```Text
http://example.com
额外添加选项(Options)
```
可以看到，标签内容确实插入成功了。不过插入时机不能满足我的想法，我希望在Markdown文件解析之前替换，这样2的链接才能正确解析，请问可以做到么？. @unnamed42 谢谢 👍  .

I arrived here after having this problem with npm and want to provide the correct answer. Never use sudo to install modules. Running sudo allows anything to happen which is very dangerous. And simply changing ownership of the folder which is outside your home directory will potentially cause trouble if you ever change to a different user account. What you want to do is configure npm so that it uses a directory within your home directory. See the docs on the npm website for the current instructions.
https://docs.npmjs.com/getting-started/fixing-npm-permissions#option-two-change-npms-default-directory.

A good starting step for this kind of migration would be to add an engines.node field in your package.json so older versions already get a warning.
I am not very aware of linting tools for Javascript. My main language is Typescript that already solves many common issues, and I use tslint for code style. npm test runs tslint as part of the tests. One of the best features of tslint is the --fix option that solves most of issues. . Closing this issue since the main question was answered:
Hexo's policy is to target the latest and maintained LTS versions of Node. It means that it is acceptable to use new features as long as they work on the maintained LTS versions.
For reference: nodejs/Releases. You cannot place breakpoints in pug files (they are not interpreted by Node but by the pug engine, it's not the same level of interpreter).
You could get the variables when pug's render function is called but it's somewhat hard to access (in node_modules).
I personally resort to printing the values in the page (by placing pre #{JSON.stringify(variableToLog)} in the pug file) but I'm interested if a better solution is available.. The larger issue here is that you want to map an application state to a URL. This is not a trivial operation and is outside of the scope of path resolution. This requires knowledge about how the URLs of your website are structured.
Your choice it to treat each of the components of your state as a string and use them as individual segment of the URL path. What if someone want to use query parameters, fragments or wants concatenate a few values in the same segment of the URL path?
If all you want is to join path segments and resolve the URL, then simply compose the existing functions as suggested above.
As a nit, joining on forward slashes does not properly escape special characters. Joining path segments should be done with the dedicated function require("path").posix.join. This is also better semantically: it helps to communicate the intent of the operation.
js
url_for(path.posix.join("page", i.toString(10)))
Ultimately, if you want a more complex behavior, the best solution is to write your own function.

. I might not understand your use case, but from my point of view, it's unnecessary to get the https to show up. Using hexo probably means you're trying to build a static site. Static sites don't have much of a backend (unless you're using some third party server to do analytics, store comments, etc, but even then you don't control your data), and you won't have things like logins.
https means you're using SSL, which is crucial to keeping user information secure. But the thing is, if you have a static site readers don't provide you with personally identifiable information through your website. Since they don't provide you with sensitive information, is there any reason to make your site https?. The relevant source is here. 
It looks like the error happens when nunjucks hits this line: https://github.com/hexojs/hexo-generator-feed/blob/master/atom.xml#L9
So something in a {{ posts.first().updated.toISOString() }} call doesn't return correctly. Do you have any posts?. I also noticed that creating a new layout, like customLayout.ejs, and having a scaffold customLayout.md and running hexo new customLayout a-custom-post will also generate a post without any default content from the customLayout.md. The front matter will be correct, but all the content isn't included in the newly created post.
If someone knows the codebase well enough, they could just point me to related files/lines in the code and I might be able to make a PR.. I figured I'd comment for completeness and to document this for my original post. Specifying post.html as the <layout|scaffold> doesn't work because of this code path:
Technical details:
hexo/scaffold.js line 33 for Scaffold.prototype._listDir actually removes the file extension name when reading a the scaffold names. Thus, specifying post.html will actually return a list of file names like post, page. However, these extension stripped filenames are matched against the name in Scaffold.prototype._getScaffold, thus the default hardcoded scaffold is returned, leading to an empty content field for yfmSplit in hexo/post.js. 
I guess it's kind of convenient that you can just pass in post instead of post.html, so this part is a non-issue for me now.
. Regarding the second scenario I mentioned, it's another matter. It seems that calling hexo new customLayout new-post will fail because preprocessing happens to the <layout> argument. It becomes all lowercase. Thus, the match for customLayout === customlayout will fail in Scaffold.prototype._getScaffold, so the program thinks the scaffold can't be found.
The consequences are that we can't make scaffolds with non-all-lowercased letters. Either this should be fixed, or this should be documented directly in https://hexo.io/docs/writing.html#Scaffolds. If there is some sort of consensus, I can try to make the PRs.

In addition, lodash.isDate() returns the result if util.types.isDate() exists, if one exists.
Although it may be corrected, I think that the necessity to thoroughly perform the contents of this PR is thinner than other libraries such as warehouse.
That's because hexo exports the lodash namespace and it's a big size as a library.. Yes, your review is correct.
In that part, we refactor the behavior with no change in the difference of only two lines of the file.
In other words, this refactoring is a greedy result, oh .. Even if we abandon the return value that calls should() like the sample code of https://www.chaijs.com/guide/styles/#using-should-in-es2015, in principle no problem.
By calling should(), the should property is added to Object.prototype via Object.defineProperty(). You can use should from almost any value after that.
However, since only null, undefined, or prototype null objects can not call Object.prototype from the prototype chain, you can not get should property.
The return value of should() is used to assert such as should.not.exist(undefined) for these values.. If that comment is about this line, the purpose is to reduce the scope of result.. Since the initial initial value was 1, it is being handed over..

Here are some notes for the other guys who may also suffering:
- as NoahDragon's comment, update hexo-renderer-pandoc to 0.2.0
- remove hexo-inject, and also hexo-math
- add files "mathjax.ejs" and "after_footer.ejs" in themes/next/layout/_partials . Contents of these files can be found via Google
- if you have engine: 'mathjax' in the _config.yml of your root dir of the blog, comment it out

I mean the code-block should be insides quote-block.. @zhuzhuyule Emmm, actually, with the default hexo-render-marked it will broken, so does hexo-render-markdown-it. It's not caused by different markdown render, because the detection of code-block is not done by render engine, but by the Hexo built-in filter backtick_code_block.
Thus, to make markdown render work well, you have to remove or improve the filter backtick_code_block.
If you just remove it, you'll lose the syntax highlight of code and have to rebuild the highlight yourself..

```

title: Some TItle

categories:
- Category 1
pinned: true

xxx
```
and edit your template file as follows (using jade as example)
- page.posts.each(function (item) {
        if post.pinned
                renderPost()
- })
- page.posts.each(function (item) {
        if not post.pinned
                renderPost()

derrick-null:
Well, this issue is due to the version of Nodejs and centos.
1. The default version of Nodejs installed by yum command is v0.10.48, this version just support 7% of ES6
2. 32bit CentOS 6 don't support nodejs 6.x
3. Change CentOS 6 to 64bit
4. Install nodejs 6.x
curl -sL https://rpm.nodesource.com/setup_6.x | bash -
yum install -y nodejs
I changed Centos to 64Bit and installed Node6.X then install the hexo and it running well.

baoang:
涉及到对_post目录下的博文管理的问题，我觉得可能把博文的文件名进行一下规则的命名会好一些，比如命名成年-月-日-标题这样的。我自己的是从WP中导出再导入Hexo的，标题是乱码，的确不方便管理。不过有一个插件可以很好的解决这个问题。
另外，Hexo中提供了几类Layout，也许把这个功能增强一下会解决你的需要？. 我用的是NexT风格套件，最近因要处理数学公式，也遇到了这样的问题。在解决问题和配置的过程中看了下NexT的模板配置文件中的注释，才发现原来Hexo有多个markdown的渲染引擎，光是官方在plugin页面中发布的就不下三四种。
目前来讲，用到渲染数学公式的，大体有两个代码，一是MathJax，另一个是Katex。在采用这两种代码的时候，我注意到使用Marked、Markdown-it、Markdown-it-Plus、Kramer等跑出来的效果不太一样，不止是反应到数学公式的展现上，还包括类如[^1]就是注释、行内加粗、代码片段那个backtick标记是否最后能有个空格等问题上。用Katex的话，某些Markdown的渲染引擎还必须支持到特定的Katex版本。
总之，要能成功的渲染出非普通文本格式的html文件，并不是一件特别轻松的事。当然，Hexo不同与Hugo，后者干脆是独立的且有专门运行的Go程序在处理，事先封包基本上不用考虑什么依赖包的需要，当然也就不需要进行Markdown引擎的选择了，一切都由官方指定。
从StaticGen的对比来看，Hexo已经从当初的老二掉了下来，变成老四。也许官方在提供丰富的plugin的同时，也可以在指定固定或官荐插件方面提供给用户更多的信息，比如说，官定内置的Markdown渲染引擎是hexo-renderer-marked，但在哪些情况下，我们推荐使用hexo-renderer-markdown-it？哪些情况下，由于各个开发者不能及时维护，因而目前推荐大家在使用什么功能方面，我们推荐大家使用hexo-renderer-kramer，类似这样的？. 会不会同某个js代码未能完全载入有关？
我自己用NexT的主题，出现过addThis的代码加载不出分享按钮，我查过生成的页面中是有addThis的代码的，也未用广告屏蔽的工具，想了半天，应当是与代码未能够完全载入有关，因为偶尔它能显示出分享按钮。.

xiaotan828:
最近大家都出现了这个问题，https://superuser.com/questions/1297583/git-push-failing-with-fatal-httprequestexception-encountered    不是电脑或者文件本身的的问题，是Github最近停用了TLS 1.0和v 1.1，文章看这里 
解决方案：在这个页面下载最新版Git Credential Manager for Windows . @JLHwung 最好能把这个页面置顶以下什么的，很多人应该都会遇到这个问题. @steve-yuan-8276 你可以在这里尝试安装Git Credential Manager for Mac，理论上重新安装最新版git也能解决.
breakingcoder: you can try command :  "git config --global credential.helper wincred" in git bash terminal.

特别字符 | 描述
---- | ----
^ | 匹配输入字符串的开始位置，除非在方括号表达式中使用，此时它表示不接受该字符集合。要匹配 ^ 字符本身，请使用 \^。
{ | 标记限定符表达式的开始。要匹配 {，请使用 \{。
\| | 指明两项之间的一个选择。要匹配 \|，请使用 \|。
‘*’、‘+’和‘?’限定符都是贪婪的，因为它们会尽可能多的匹配文字，只有在它们的后面加上一个‘?’就可以实现非贪婪或最小匹配。

kylebakerio:
There's no reason why it shouldn't. I'm on Debian stretch and just used it last night.
I'm using Node 7.8.0, npm 5.7.1, though I had some problem with something (maybe a plugin?) for which switching to yarn resolved the issue.
But this isn't really an issue, and seem inappropriate here. Just try it first. I imagine it should probably work on any modern version of node.. I should mention: I resolved this by just changing the logo's name and changing what pointed to it in the config, though I imagine I could also have just deleted 'logo.png' in the public folder forcing it to re-draw a new copy of the image, which would now be the correct one.. Hmm. I personally think of this as faulty design.. hexo generate only renders assets once, but then never updates them? It's pretty unintuitive behavior, imho. I understand it makes it faster to not track them, but surely conditional diffing could be used to decide whether to re-render any/all assets or not. Couldn't last-modified dates be checked? Then, perhaps, a question could be asked?
If not, maybe something like "generate-full" and "generate-fast" could be used? (as concepts, not saying use those particular long examples per se.)
It's not a dealbreaker, and I'm not a contributor so I won't tell you guys how to design your app, but as a user I just find this to be expectation-breaking. Worst case, I think a couple seconds of rendering time isn't really a big deal compared to silent unintuitive failures like this.
.
bobd91:
LOL, if you remove code then the coverage % goes down even though all of the code you have changed is covered!
I only removed the code in the first place as my original changes caused a particular branch to never be executed (code run if variable is not an array on something that is now always an array).
Feeling frustrated with coveralls.
. > Not indeterminate manner, but take first catched language in themes/languages directory. 
On your system maybe, but the order of the language files is dependent upon the order that Node's readdir function provides.  It is well documented that Node's readdir on Windows does not provide a sorted list and even on Linux the underlying readdir C function makes no promises on ordering.
. This is a difficult problem as the documented behaviour (use 'default' language file if no language specified) did not work so you had to come up with some scheme that did work.
Relying on the behaviour of a bug is always risky, and the longer the bug takes to get fixed the more people rely on the buggy behaviour and the more pain fixing the bug causes.
However, this should not be classified as a breaking change.  The behaviour that you and others relied upon was not a documented feature but the side-effect of a defect that was reported and scheduled to be fixed. 
. @ivan-nginx 
you are of course correct, when a bug is this old many people will depend upon the buggy behaviour so it would be best if the fix did not break everything.  I could have made it so that if a default file did not exist then it would fall back to the old method of selecting the file.
I have corrected this as pull request #3110.  It is too late for you I know but hopefully it might help some others who have not updated their Hexo version yet..

Ashisacat:
I'm not sure if i'm misunderstanding here, JSX is not implemented within Hexo - it's project dependent, requires compiling (so babel?) and is not taken in by Hexo.
By the looks of things, you actually want a partial using the current templating engine - this can be done by creating your Thingie or your ThingieWithTitle as their own partial files and including partials in the overall template as required.. The whole thing is parsed so you won't be able to execute arbitrary code from within a post.
You could, however, amend your theme so that the partial is included within the post?
This is kind of outside of the remit of the core hexo repo though :).

SnailDove:
@jdhao  hexo generate failed after I did as following:
Firstly, you need to uninstall the original renderer hexo-renderer-marked, and install one of the renderer above:
npm un hexo-renderer-marked --save
npm i hexo-renderer-pandoc --save # or hexo-renderer-kramed
Secondly, in next/_config.yml, turn on enable of math and choose mathjax as engine.
math:
  enable: true
  ...
  engine: mathjax
  #engine: katex
Finally, run standard Hexo generate, deploy process or start the server:
```
hexo clean && hexo g -d
or hexo clean && hexo s
```.

One day ago, It's so easy to do it. No more copy&paste just 2 steps.

put your source code in.
    Make sure dir /source/downloads/code existed. And put your source code file in it.
    bash
    > ls source/downloads/code/
    filename.py
Insert a whole script.
    bash
    {% include_code filename lang:python filename.py %}
Voilà it works.

edwinnyawoli:
The themes/landscape is in the same parent directory of the source directory. The repository is at this link . In one of my previous attempts to get it working, It also gave a similar error saying 
tag set on line 217 in node_modules/nunjucks/CHANGELOG.md  was not a valid Liquid tag.. I just tried 👆  and everything works fine locally, but I'm still getting the error when I push to github.. Found the solution. I put a .nojekyll file in the root of the directory and pushed it to github. Everything works perfectly now 👌 . Github was processing my repo as a jekyll blog, probably because of the presence of the __config.yml file and jekyll being the default generator on Github. So I added a .nojekyll file to the root so that Github doesn't try to process it as a jekyll blog..

解决方案：

  "hexo": {
    "version": ""
  }
}
```
如果还是有问题，可以更新hexo之后，在新的文件夹中重新进行hexo init。

Here's one way I addressed it:
```yaml
hexo-server plugin
server:
  port: 4000
  log: false
  ip: 127.0.0.1
  compress: false
  serveStatic:
    cacheControl: true
    etag: false
    lastModified: false
```
Notice the serveStatic options. We should probably fix it in the hexo-server plugin.

ahuigo:
Permission problem. 
npm WARN checkPermissions Missing write access to /usr/local/lib/node_modules
Use sudo or proper user who has write permission of /usr/local/lib/node_modules to install it.
npm install hexo -g. Some ideas about decreasing the building time of Hexo.
1.  The db.json
    1. Stores only markdown files's meta info(path,title,date,updated,category).  and building info such as last building time.
    2. Don't cache the whole file content in db.json. Read the content directly from file system If we need it.
2. We  can just find out the modified files via git ,find, or other tools . https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16085958/scripts-find-the-files-have-been-changed-in-last-24-hours
3. Support incremental building. We can just build the modified files only when build site every time. 
Building should not relate to  unmodified files .
For example:
```python
hexo g;
{build_meta:{'last_time':'2018-09-29...'}, files_meta:{...}}
dbinfo = parse('db.json') 
cmd = 'git diff-index --cached --name-status --diff-filter=ACMRD HEAD -- ./_posts '
output = getoutput(cmd).strip()
if output:
    # find out modified files and deleted files
    modified_blogs = {}
    delete_blogs = []
    for line in output.split('\n'):
        status, path = line.split('\t')
        if status == 'D':
            delete_blogs.append(path)
            continue
    blog = parseBlog(path)
    modified_blogs[path] = blog['meta']

# delete file
if path not in dbinfo['files_meta']:
    html_path = f'public/{path}.html'
    getoutput(f'rm {html_path}')
    hexo_delete_tags(file_meta)
    hexo_delete_category(file_meta)

# add & update file(Incremental Building)
for path,file_meta in modified_blogs.items():
    hexo_generate_html(path)
    hexo_add_update_tags(file_meta)
    hexo_add_update_category(file_meta)

# save db.json
hexo_update_db('db.json',modified_blogs, delete_blogs)

```

itszero:
I spent some time digging into this today and found out where the bug is. Unfortunately removing timezone from _config.yml is not a valid workaround me because I run the build on a cloud server just prior to deploy which is running in UTC timezone.
Why the timezone is off?
In plugins/filter/post_permalink.js we can see how the path is constructed. It reads from data.date which is prepared by the hexo database layer. If you print the value, you will see that while the timestamp is correct, its timezone is off -- It's just UTC.
Why is the timezone specified in _config.yml not applied?
Next, I dig into why the timezone specified in the config file was not applied. The timezone is being used in models/types/moment.js in the cast function: It reads options.timezone where it is defined in models/post.js by reading [ctx.config.timezone](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/models/post.js#L25).
Why the config appeared as the default config?
Now if you print out ctx.config, you will see that it is NOT your personal config. Instead, it's the default config comes with hexo. Digging into how hexo initialize hexo/index.js, we see that [registerModels](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/index.js#L100) happened before [load_config](https://github.com/hexojs/hexo/blob/master/lib/hexo/index.js#L169). That's why!
Now, how to fix this?
This is where I'm not sure what's the best way to proceed. I think the current logic is wrong. We obviously are using config before it is loaded. We have a few options here:

Move the initialization until after we load the config (aka here): This makes the most sense to me, however, it breaks tests because some of them don't call hexo.init() before using hexo stuff. I'm not sure how big the assumptions were. hexo.init() is also, unfortunately, an async function so we can't just simply call it in those callsites too.
Make load_config synchronous and load it before init: It's a safer way to fix this as it maintains the API interface. However, now we will be reading config file before init() is being called which might break some other cases as well. It also makes the init function useless.

I'm happy to code this up and send a PR, but I would like to discuss which approach would be more preferable?
Thanks!.

52Heartz:
我今天也遇到了这个问题，我对问题的理解以及解决方法如下：
首先，{% test %} 是一个未知的标签，Hexo 是不会支持的，支持的标签可以参考这个官方文档：标签插件（Tag Plugins）
另外，即使这个标签是 Hexo 支持的，那么 {% xxx %} 和 {% endxxx %} 需要配合使用，一个标志开始，一个标志结束，不能只用一个。
只使用一个会报错 unexpected end of file。如果使用错误的标签名会报错 unknown block tag: xxx。
另外，如果文章中出现单独的 {{ 或者 }} 也会报错，原因也是因为 {{ 和 }} 被 Hexo 当作标签的标志来处理了。
更多的内容，可以参考我博客的这篇文章：Hexo 的 Template render error 错误.

Thanks!. Hexo Rendering API is what you need.
Before calling res.render, use the Hexo rendering API to render the blog and then pass the result to locals parameter.
To exclude header or footer, customizing templates in your Hexo theme can achieve this.
Check out this page for more info about Hexo templates.

I think there is another way worth trying to render the Hexo blog under route /blog.
By Hexo router API, you can make use of the goodness of NodeJS Stream API like the following example code.
Since hexo.route.get() returns a Readable, you can pipe it to the express res object, which is a Writable.
pipe method will end the response for you by default.
js
app.get("/blog", (req, res) => {
    hexo.route.get(req.path).pipe(res);
});
After delegating the rendering job to Hexo, include your blog.ejs as a part of customized templates in your Hexo theme.

舉個例子, 在你 package.json 中加入 build 腳本 (如下所示), 並改用 npm run build 建構博客。
json
{
  "scripts": {
    "build": "hexo g && shx cp D:\\hexo-blog\\.gitlab-ci.yml D:\\hexo-blog\\public\\.gitlab-ci.yml"
  }
}
示例中使用了 shx 依賴, 透過 npm i shx -D 安裝為開發依賴。.

. 

(Option 2)
I recommend install packages from your npm-shrinkwrap.json file instead of directly installing latest hexo-cli, as this package is currently affected by its deps highlight.js and waiting for fix.
So do npm shrinkwrap to generate above json file, and then npm install will install packages from shrinkwrap locked version, such that you are installing from a known working version, rather the latest one.

chocoluffy:
(Option 1)
npm install -g hexo-cli --ignore-scripts can help, as it simply download the packages without building it, thus it will avoid the error caused by dep package like here in highlight.js. But use it with caution, as it may cause other useful packages to stop building as well. 
(Option 2)
I recommend install packages from your npm-shrinkwrap.json file instead of directly installing latest hexo-cli, as this package is currently affected by its deps highlight.js and waiting for fix.
So do npm shrinkwrap to generate above json file, and then npm install will install packages from shrinkwrap locked version, such that you are installing from a known working version, rather the latest one.
I encounter the same problem as title on Travis when deploying my hexo blog, and the above-mentioned tricks help solve the error. . (Option 1)
